title: Ticket #6576: Remove code that adds/removes TARGET. scoping in ClassAd expressions
description:
This code was added in the initial transition from old to new ClassAds. At the time, during match evaluation, references to attributes in the peer ad had to have a TARGET scope prefix in new ClassAds (but didn't in old ClassAds). This code was an attempt to hide this change in evaluation semantics from users. It was prone to a lot of problems, so we ultimately added a hack in the new ClassAds library to allow the evaluation semantics of old ClassAds. We haven't tried to make users change their expressions to follow the new ClassAds semantics, so this code is just dead weight.

In the one place where this code is in actual use (the EvalBool() that takes an unparsed expression string), none of the callers need the removal of TARGET scope prefixes.
